entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 9.9 a-b** *संयन्ता ... धौम्यो ब्रह्मविदुत्तमः*
Who is described as the best among the Brahmins?
A) Sahadeva B) Bhīma C) Arjuna D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: A) Sahadeva • The verse explicitly names Sahadeva as the Brahmin par excellence. • Bhīma and Arjuna are warriors, not Brahmins. • Kṛṣṇa is a Yadava, not a Brahmin.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 11.11 a-b** *एष वै सर्वकल्याणः समाधिस्तव ...*
Who is called the "supreme samādhi"?
A) Bhīṣma B) Drona C) Kṛpa D) Bharata
entry.answer: D) Bharata • "Bharata" refers to the legendary king, a central figure in the Mahābhārata. • Bhīṣma and Drona are warriors, not samādhi. • Kṛpa is a teacher but not the "supreme samādhi."

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 12.12 a-b** *हिमवत्यनुशिष्टोऽसि मेरुसावर्णिना ...*
Who instructed you on the Himalayas?
A) Merusāvarṇa B) Bhīṣma C) Drona D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: A) Merusāvarṇa • Merusāvarṇa is a legendary teacher mentioned in the Mahābhārata. • Bhīṣma and Drona are warriors, not Himalayan instructors. • Kṛṣṇa is a later figure.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 14.14 a-b** *द्रष्ता सदा नारदस्य ... पुरोहितः*
Who is the priest of Narada?
A) Dhūmya B) Vidura C) Kṛpa D) Bhīṣma
entry.answer: A) Dhūmya • Dhūmya is explicitly named as Narada's priest. • Vidura and Bhīṣma are advisors, not priests. • Kṛpa is a teacher but not linked to Narada.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 19.19 a-b** *कथं वत्स्यथ दुर्गेषु वनेष्वृद्धिविनाकृताः*
How do the Pandavas fare in forests?
A) Victorious B) Defeated C) Exiled D) Forgotten
entry.answer: A) Victorious • The verse implies their resilience and success in forests. • "Vidhā" (forest) is a metaphor for challenges they overcome. • "Vidhā" also means "fate," suggesting divine support.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 21.21 a-b** *एवं विलपतीं कुन्तीमभिसान्त्व्य ... प्रवव्रजुः*
Who led the Pandavas into exile after comforting Kunti?
A) Yudhiṣṭhira B) Bhīma C) Arjuna D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: A) Yudhiṣṭhira • Yudhiṣṭhira is the eldest Pandava and leader. • Bhīma and Arjuna are warriors, not leaders in this context. • Kṛṣṇa is a charioteer, not the leader of the exile.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 24.24 a-b** *एवमेते महोत्पाता वनं गच्छति पाण्डवे*
What event caused the Pandavas to flee into the forest?
A) Solar eclipse B) Earthquake C) War D) Famine
entry.answer: A) Solar eclipse • "Mahōtpāta" (great calamity) refers to celestial signs like eclipses. • Earthquakes and wars are mentioned elsewhere but not in this verse. • Famine is a later consequence.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 31.31 a-b** *इत्युक्त्वा दिवमाक्रम्य क्षिप्रमन्तरधीयत*
What did the Pandavas do after speaking to the gods?
A) Fought B) Fled C) Prayed D) Slept
entry.answer: B) Fled • "Kṣipram" (quickly) implies urgency, suggesting flight. • "Antaradhīyata" (disappeared) aligns with fleeing. • Fighting and praying are not directly indicated.

entry.question:
**Araṇyaka-parva 36.36 a-b** *धर्मतः पाण्डुपुत्रा वै वनं गच्छन्ति निर्जिताः*
Why did the Pandavas go to the forest?
A) To fight B) To seek refuge C) To conquer D) To mourn
entry.answer: B) To seek refuge • "Nirjitāḥ" (defeated) implies they fled after losing a battle. • "Vana" (forest) is a common refuge in the Mahābhārata. • Fighting and conquering are contradictory to "nirjitāḥ."

What did the Pandavas do after their exile?
A) Fasted B) Performed yajnas C) Fought D) Mourned
